messages.message:
A file system bug that I think was exposed by renaming a parent folder:

(a) `review-ocr` can see a file in batch-mode and the IBOCR loads as text: https://www.instabase.com/apps/ocr/review-batch/dlluncor/lending-club/fs/Instabase%20Drive/workspace-anantb/Dev/Data/all/out-new.2019.01.25/other/out/s1_process_files/LAST_YEAR_W2_1502792919109.ibocr

(b) but when you try to open up the file, you get a “file doesn’t exist” error: https://www.instabase.com/apps/ocr/review-doc/dlluncor/lending-club/fs/Instabase%20Drive/workspace-anantb/Dev/Data/all/out-new.2019.01.25/other/out/s1_process_files/LAST_YEAR_W2_1502792919109.ibocr?i=0&ibflowresults=

(c) This error seems to be infecting every file in this directory: https://www.instabase.com/dlluncor/lending-club/fs/Instabase%20Drive/workspace-anantb/Dev/Data/all/out-new.2019.01.25/other/out/s1_process_files/. I have previously renamed `all/out/other` path of the path to `all/out-new.2019.01.25/other`.
where should i file a ticket for this?
